manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: MAD SHARK PRO CHEF KNIFE FOR HOME COOK MAD SHARK CARE FOR YOU * It is not suitable for slicing through frozen foods as this may make the blade lose its sharpness. * The knife isn't designed for use in a hot flame because this may make the protective finish to wear away and give the blade a permanent dull finish. * The chrome-finish doesn't rust or tarnish easily and requires minimal maintenance. Also, cleaning the knife is as simple as washing with clean water and mild soap. * Hand washing is recommended and dishwasher safe.

Why Choose MAD SHARK 8-inch Chef Knife? SHARP AND CUTS PRECISELY The extraordinary quality German steel allows for easy blade maintenance and rapid sharpening for a razor-sharp edge. Nitrogen cooled for enhanced hardness, flexibility and corrosion resistance to assure your best cut. Triple riveted handle surrounds a full tang - Highly impervious to heat, cold and moisture. ERGONOMIC DESIGN, WELL BALANCED The balanced handle with ergonomic design gives you effortless cuts of meats, fish, sushi, vegetables and fruits. PREMIUM GERMAN HC STAINLESS STEEL Premium German HC stainless steel enables chef’s knives wear-resistant, durable, rust and stain resistant. MULTI-PURPOSE Pro CHEF’S KNIFE Being a multi-functional knife, the MAD SHARK 8-inch chef's knife is suitable for most cutting applications in the kitchen. Great for chopping, mincing, slicing and dicing a variety of foods.

Specification Size & Weight Overall: 14" [35.5cm] Handle: 5" [12.7cm] Blade: 8.0" [20.5cm] Blade Thickness: 2.5mm Weight: 0.53 Lbs/240g Love food, Love Cooking, Enjoy life We love food, love cooking and life.Whether you're a hobbyist or pro,our aim is to enhance the experience of your culinary creation. We love to bring a pure sense of satisfaction to everyone of you around the world who use our tools everyday. CARE AND USE Watch out for the sharp cutter edge and eliminate direct hand touch. Clean the knife with soapy cloth after every use and keep it dry and safe. Hand washing is recommended yet safe for dishwasher. Hone the knife with honing steel every 2-3 month to maintain its sharpness.

Gift box on kinds of festivals The knife comes in a high-quality black gift box is very suitable as a gift to parents and friends on kinds of festival, such as Mother's Day, Father's Day、Thanksgiving Day、Black Friday、Christmas day、New Year、Easter Day、Halloween、birthday, etc.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The MAD SHARK Pro Kitchen Knife has truly exceeded my expectations! This 8-inch premium chef knife is a cut above the rest. Crafted from high-carbon stainless steel of German quality, it boasts incredible sharpness that makes slicing and dicing a breeze. The ergonomic handle ensures a comfortable grip, even during extended use. The included gift box is a thoughtful touch, making it a perfect present for any cooking enthusiast.I've used this knife for a variety of tasks, from chopping meat to slicing delicate fruits and vegetables. It effortlessly glides through everything I throw at it, saving me time and effort in the kitchen. I can confidently say that this knife has become an indispensable tool in my culinary adventures.What sets the MAD SHARK Pro Kitchen Knife apart is its exceptional sharpness and durability. It maintains its edge remarkably well, reducing the need for frequent sharpening. The sleek design adds a touch of elegance to my kitchen, and the quality of craftsmanship is evident.In conclusion, if you're in search of a top-notch chef's knife, look no further than the MAD SHARK Pro Kitchen Knife. Its outstanding performance and thoughtful design make it a standout choice. I've fallen in love with this knife, and it has elevated my cooking experience to a whole new level. Don't miss out on the opportunity to own this culinary masterpiece!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2020
reviews.reviewText: We have been using this knife since Christmas, and we are so happy with it. We bought a small Cangshan set for my MIL, and honestly this knife feels and cuts just as well as their more expensive Chef knife. The quality feels amazing, the handle feels so solid (and it’s gorgeous), and it cuts so much cleaner and easier than the basic knifes we got as a wedding gift many years ago. No, this isn’t meant to compete with those Damascus style German carbon steel $$$ knives, but it’s an amazing value for the price. If you need a good quality chef knife for under $30, this is absolutely the knife for you. The quality is just excellent. It definitely surprised my husband and I! We love it.Also- it does not come with a protective sheath, so we bought a bamboo drawer knife “block” to store it in with our other knives. We store our knives in a drawer instead of a counter knife block.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works a lot better than my other cheap knife set!
reviews.reviewText: I don't know anything about knives, other than what a Cutco salesperson told me (to sell me their knives). The cutcos were great, but I lost them in a divorce, and somehow wound up with the cheapest worst knives imaginable. I mean they will cut steak if you really work at it, but they just do not work for chopping vegetables or anything. I finally decided I needed something to chop veggies and just be an all around versatile knife to have in the kitchen. I'm not a chef and I only begrudgingly cook, so I didn't want to spend a fortune.I got this one because of the other positive reviews and I have to say they were right. I actually have to be really careful with this knife because it is so sharp. I won't even let my kids touch it (they are in middle school) when they are cooking because I'm that scared of how sharp it is lol. Respect this knife. It is really big too. I've been able to chop everything up with ease and am very happy with this purchase!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great blade, pretty maneuverable, but the handle is a little awkward
reviews.reviewText: I recently bought this and a Mosfiata knife with similar features and of the same length, just to try them both out.The blade is very sharp, indexes well, and the longer handle makes it pretty maneuverable. I'll have to try quartering chicken with it before I pass final judgement but thus far it does well cutting steaks and filleting (Though I also managed to fillet my finger a little bit)My only real complaint is that the finger guard is a little small for my large fingers and the handle shape is a bit awkward. I have fairly large hands so it's a little on the thin side for me, with the only thickening being at the very back of the handle. This makes it difficult for me to hold, but can generally be solved by choking up on the knife a bit more or gripping the back of the blade. If you have large hands like me it'll be fine for short prep but may grow uncomfortable over long periods. Great for dinner for 2-4, less so for family holiday prep

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this knife in 2019 and I’m just now reviewing it; it’s 2023! The knife is excellent. It’s still my main knife. It’s in superior shape. Follow the direction. Don’t let it sit in water, clean it and hand dry it immediately and always use a cutting board. I highly recommend this knife.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Muy buen cuchillo excelente diseño, construcción y balance, los materiales son de muy buena calidad, altamente recomendable.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My first non-dollar store knife.
reviews.reviewText: Upon initial inspection and use, this is a pretty nice knife. I haven't owned any better ones to compare it to, but it seems to be much higher quality than the dollar store knives I'm used to using. It's substantial and weighty but not too heavy, the handle feels nice, and the blade seems super sharp. I cut some zucchini with it and, well... it cut it.The length of it is a bit longer than I'm used to, so I'm not super comfortable getting a fancy with my knife skills yet, but hopefully I'll adjust.The finger guard, is a nice touch, though I'm not sure if I'm ever going to use it. I'll just try not to cut my fingers.
